intro: Veronica charadze, commonly known as the Georgian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
